ground_truth: Fergus shrugs, and she looks at Fergus directly, sitting down next to him. Fergus says nothing and shrugs again. The burly man comes up to her and suddenly jerks her roughly off the stool, spilling her drink. He drags her through the crowd as the barman eyes him. Fergus suddenly stands and makes his way to the door. Fergus comes out, walks a few yards, and hears voices down an alley. He looks up it and sees Dil pushing Dave away. Dave grabs her, turns her roughly, but she beats his arms away and staggers away from him. They both bump into Fergus, who just stands there and doesn't move an inch. She smiles, and he holds it up to show her. Dave eyes Fergus, who in response grabs Dave's wrists and upends him on the ground. Fergus puts his foot on Dave's neck and presses down, looking to Dil, and then presses his foot again. She bends low to Dave, whose voice is softer. Fergus removes his foot, and Dil grabs his arm, drawing him away. They walk out of the alley, and Fergus looks back to see Dave is rising. Fergus and Dil climb slowly upstairs, noticing a movement lower down the staircase and seeing Dave holding his neck. Dil leans close to Fergus and tilts up her face, and Fergus kisses her tenderly. She goes in and closes the door, while Fergus stands and looks down at Dave, who turns to leave. Dil walks out of the salon smiling and walks toward Fergus, who takes a bunch of flowers from behind his back. She holds them with theatrical feeling, laughs, leans toward him, and kisses him in a classically old-fashioned way as the girls inside the salon pull back a curtain and clap. She takes his arm and walks off with him. Fergus and Dil are looking at their menus when a waiter places drinks on their table and then leaves. They are walking in an alleyway toward her house when suddenly a car drives very fast toward them with headlights on. Fergus pulls her into a doorway to avoid it. The car continues down the road, stops, and then screeches off. She looks down toward where the car has pulled away. A car pulls up behind Dil and Fergus, and she touches his cheek. Dil comes in in the darkness, and Fergus stands like a shadow in the doorway. The light comes on; she takes off her raincoat as Fergus enters slowly. He looks around the room, noticing an exaggerated femininity about everything in it. Fergus looks at the mantelpiece and sees a picture of Jody, and the camera tracks into the soldier's smiling face. His reverie is broken by the sound of a voice outside—Dave's. She opens the window door, and they see Dave on the street, in a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Fergus shrugs, and she gazes at Fergus directly, seating herself down beside him. Fergus utters nothing and shrugs once more. The husky man approaches her and abruptly yanks her harshly off the stool, spilling her beverage. He hauls her through the throng as the barman watches him. Fergus suddenly rises and proceeds toward the exit. Fergus exits, ambles a few yards, and discerns voices down an alley. He glances up it and spots Dil shoving Dave away. Dave seizes her, turns her harshly, but she strikes his arms away and totters away from him. They both collide with Fergus, who just stands there and doesn’t budge an inch. She grins, and he holds it up to show her. Dave observes Fergus, who in response seizes Dave’s wrists and flips him onto the ground. Fergus places his foot on Dave’s neck and presses down, looking to Dil, and then presses his foot again. She leans low to Dave, whose voice is gentler. Fergus lifts his foot, and Dil grasps his arm, drawing him away. They stroll out of the alley, and Fergus glances back to see Dave is rising. Fergus and Dil ascend slowly upstairs, noticing a motion lower down the staircase and spotting Dave clutching his neck. Dil leans close to Fergus and tilts up her face, and Fergus kisses her gently. She enters and closes the door, while Fergus stands and gazes down at Dave, who turns to depart. Dil strolls out of the salon smiling and walks toward Fergus, who takes a bunch of blooms from behind his back. She holds them with theatrical emotion, laughs, leans toward him, and kisses him in a classically old-fashioned manner as the girls inside the salon draw back a curtain and applaud. She takes his arm and walks off with him. Fergus and Dil are examining their menus when a waiter sets drinks on their table and then departs. They are walking in an alleyway toward her house when suddenly a vehicle drives very fast toward them with headlights on. Fergus pulls her into a doorway to evade it. The vehicle continues down the street, halts, and then screeches away. She gazes down toward where the vehicle has sped away. A vehicle pulls up behind Dil and Fergus, and she touches his cheek. Dil enters in the darkness, and Fergus stands like a shadow in the doorway. The illumination comes on; she removes her raincoat as Fergus enters slowly. He surveys the room, noticing an exaggerated femininity about everything in it. Fergus looks at the mantelpiece and sees a photograph of Jody, and the camera tracks into the soldier’s smiling face. His daydream is broken by the sound of a voice outside—Dave’s. She opens the window door, and they see Dave on the street, in a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Fergus shrugs, and Fergus is looked at directly by her, who sits down next to him. Nothing is said by Fergus, and he shrugs again. A burly man comes up to her, and she is suddenly jerked roughly off the stool by him, spilling her drink. She is dragged through the crowd by him as the barman eyes him. Fergus suddenly stands and makes his way to the door. Fergus comes out, walks a few yards, and voices are heard by him down an alley. Up it, he looks and sees Dil pushing Dave away. Dave grabs her, turns her roughly, but his arms are beaten away by her, and she staggers away from him. Fergus is bumped into by both of them, and not an inch is moved by him as he just stands there. A smile comes from her, and it is held up by him to show her. Fergus is eyed by Dave, who, in response, has his wrists grabbed by Fergus and is upended on the ground. Dave’s neck is pressed down on by Fergus with his foot, and Fergus looks to Dil, then his foot is pressed again. Low to Dave, whose voice is softer, she bends. Fergus removes his foot, and his arm is grabbed by Dil, who draws him away. Out of the alley, they walk, and Dave is seen rising as Fergus looks back. Slowly, upstairs Fergus and Dil climb, noticing a movement lower down the staircase, seeing Dave holding his neck. Close to Fergus, Dil leans and tilts up her face, and she is kissed tenderly by Fergus. In she goes and closes the door, while Fergus stands and looks down at Dave, who turns to leave. Smiling, Dil walks out of the salon and walks toward Fergus, from behind his back a bunch of flowers is taken by him. With theatrical feeling, they are held by her; she laughs, leans toward him, and kisses him in a classically old-fashioned way as a curtain is pulled back by the girls inside the salon, who clap. His arm is taken by her, and with him, she walks off. At their menus, Fergus and Dil are looking when drinks are placed on their table by a waiter, who then leaves. In an alleyway, they are walking toward her house when a car suddenly drives very fast toward them with headlights on. She is pulled into a doorway by Fergus to avoid it. Down the road, the car continues, stops, and then screeches off. Toward where the car has pulled away, she looks down. Behind Dil and Fergus, a car pulls up, and his cheek is touched by her. In the darkness, Dil comes in, and like a shadow in the doorway, Fergus stands. The light comes on; her raincoat is taken off by her as Fergus enters slowly. Around the room, he looks, noticing an exaggerated femininity about everything in it. The mantelpiece is looked at by Fergus, and a picture of Jody is seen by him, with the camera tracking into the soldier's smiling face. The sound of a voice outside—Dave's—breaks his reverie. The window door is opened by her, and Dave is seen by them on the street, in a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Fergus shrugs as she sits next to him. A burly man suddenly jerks her off the stool, spilling her drink, and drags her through the crowd. Fergus stands and heads to the door, hearing voices down an alley where Dil pushes Dave away. Dave grabs her, but she fends him off and bumps into Fergus, who doesn't move. Smiling, she sees Fergus upend Dave, pinning him by the neck. Fergus lets him go, and Dil leads him away. They notice Dave on the stairs, holding his neck. Dil leans in, and Fergus kisses her tenderly before she enters a room. Outside, Dil smiles, and Fergus presents flowers. She kisses him as the salon girls applaud. They walk off, looking at menus when a waiter brings drinks. Walking to her house, a fast car approaches, and Fergus pulls her aside. The car stops and screeches off. In the dark, Fergus stands like a shadow as she enters, revealing a feminine room. Fergus sees Jody's picture on the mantelpiece, but a voice outside—Dave's—breaks his thoughts. Dil opens the window, revealing Dave in a neck brace on the street.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Fergus shrugs as she sits next to him. A burly man jerks her off the stool, spilling her drink and dragging her through the crowd. Fergus follows them outside and sees Dil pushing Dave away in an alley. Dave grabs her, but she fights back, and they bump into Fergus, who stands still. Fergus confronts Dave, restraining and upending him on the ground. Dil leads Fergus away, and they leave the alley as Dave rises. Fergus and Dil go upstairs, noticing Dave below. Dil tilts her face, and Fergus kisses her. She enters her home, while Fergus watches Dave leave. Dil exits the salon smiling, and Fergus presents flowers. She laughs, kisses him as the salon girls applaud, and they leave together. At dinner, a waiter brings drinks. Walking to her house, a car speeds toward them, but Fergus pulls her to safety. Another car approaches; Dil touches Fergus's cheek. Inside, Dil removes her raincoat as Fergus observes the room's femininity and a photo of Jody. Their moment is interrupted by Dave's voice outside. Dil opens the window and sees Dave on the street, wearing a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Fergus, in a gesture of casual indifference, merely shrugs his shoulders, and she responds by looking at Fergus directly and choosing to sit down beside him. Despite her directness, Fergus remains silent, offering only another shrug. At this moment, a burly man approaches her with a sudden, aggressive demeanor, jerking her roughly off her stool, which causes her drink to spill messily. He proceeds to drag her forcefully through the crowded room, capturing the attention of the barman, who watches the scene unfold with a discerning eye. 

In reaction to this event, Fergus abruptly rises from his seat and moves determinedly toward the exit. Once outside, Fergus walks a few yards and becomes alert to the sound of voices emanating from a nearby alley. Looking in that direction, he observes Dil in a struggle with Dave, where she is attempting to push him away. Despite Dave's attempt to grab and turn her roughly, Dil manages to fend off his arms and staggers away, only to inadvertently bump into Fergus, who stands firmly, not budging an inch. She offers him a smile, and in response, he holds something up to show her. 

Dave, with a wary glance at Fergus, finds himself on the receiving end of Fergus's swift action, as Fergus seizes Dave's wrists and forcefully flips him to the ground. Firmly, Fergus places his foot on Dave's neck and applies pressure while looking at Dil, then intensifies the pressure once more. She bends down close to Dave, who now speaks with a softer tone. As the tension eases, Fergus removes his foot, and Dil takes hold of his arm, guiding him away from the scene. Together, they exit the alley, and Fergus looks back momentarily to see Dave starting to rise.

Fergus and Dil ascend the stairs slowly, their attention caught by a movement further down the staircase, where they notice Dave clutching his neck. In an intimate moment, Dil leans in closely to Fergus, tilting her face up, and Fergus responds by kissing her tenderly. She retreats inside and closes the door behind her, while Fergus remains standing, casting a glance down at Dave, who turns to make his departure.

Later, Dil emerges from the salon, a bright smile lighting her face as she approaches Fergus. Hidden behind his back, Fergus reveals a bunch of flowers, which he offers to her with a dramatic flair. She receives the flowers with an exaggerated, theatrical delight, laughing joyously, then leans toward him and bestows a kiss in a delightfully old-fashioned manner. Inside the salon, the girls draw back a curtain and clap approvingly. Taking his arm, she walks off with Fergus, a picture of companionship.

As Fergus and Dil peruse their menus in a restaurant, a waiter arrives to place refreshing drinks on their table before quietly departing. Later, as they stroll leisurely through an alleyway toward her house, a car suddenly speeds toward them with its headlights glaringly bright. Fergus acts quickly, pulling her into a nearby doorway to avoid the vehicle. The car continues past, only to stop momentarily before screeching away. She watches intently in the direction where the car sped off.

Another car then pulls up behind Dil and Fergus, prompting an affectionate gesture as she touches his cheek gently. In the enveloping darkness, Dil enters a room while Fergus remains like a shadowy figure in the doorway. When the light flickers on, she removes her raincoat, allowing Fergus to enter gradually. He takes in the room's decor, noting with curiosity the exaggerated femininity of everything around him. On the mantelpiece, his gaze falls upon a picture of Jody, and the camera closes in on the soldier's smiling visage. His moment of reflection is interrupted by the sound of a voice from outside—it’s unmistakably Dave's. She opens the window door, and together they observe Dave below on the street, now wearing a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In a display of casual indifference that speaks volumes, Fergus merely gives a nonchalant shrug of his shoulders, exuding an air of relaxed unconcern. She acknowledges this by turning her full attention toward Fergus and making the deliberate choice to sit down right next to him. Despite her directness and the clarity of her actions, Fergus chooses to remain silent, responding only with yet another indifferent shrug. At this precise moment, a burly man, with an aggressively sudden demeanor, approaches her. In a forceful manner, he yanks her roughly from her stool, causing her drink to spill over messily onto the floor. The man then proceeds to drag her through the densely packed room, capturing the keen attention of the barman, who observes the unfolding scene with a discerning and watchful eye. 

In swift response to this unfolding situation, Fergus rises suddenly from his seat, moving with determination toward the exit. Once outside, he takes a few brisk steps and becomes acutely aware of the sound of voices echoing from a nearby alleyway. He directs his gaze toward this commotion and sees Dil engaged in a struggle with Dave, attempting to push him away. Despite Dave's rough attempts to grab and turn her, Dil skillfully manages to fend him off, staggering away until she accidentally bumps into Fergus, who stands firm and unyielding. She glances up at him with a smile, and in return, he holds something up for her to see. 

Dave, casting a cautious and wary glance in Fergus's direction, finds himself on the receiving end of Fergus's swift and decisive action. Fergus seizes Dave's wrists with urgency and flips him powerfully to the ground. With a firm resolve, Fergus places his foot on Dave's neck, applying pressure while he looks at Dil, then intensifies the pressure once again. She leans in closely to Dave, who now speaks in a softer, more compliant tone. As the tension gradually eases, Fergus lifts his foot, and Dil takes hold of his arm, guiding him gently away from the scene. Together, they make their way out of the alley, and Fergus pauses momentarily to glance back, observing Dave starting to rise slowly.

Fergus and Dil ascend the stairs in a deliberate, unhurried manner, their attention drawn to a movement further down where they notice Dave clutching his neck. In a tender moment of intimacy, Dil leans closely into Fergus, tilting her face upward, to which Fergus tenderly responds by kissing her. She then steps inside and closes the door behind her, while Fergus remains standing, casting a lingering glance down at Dave, who prepares to make his departure.

Later, with a brightly lit smile adorning her face, Dil emerges from the salon and approaches Fergus. With a flourish and dramatic flair, Fergus reveals a bunch of flowers he had hidden behind his back and offers them to her. She accepts the flowers with exaggerated, theatrical delight, her laughter echoing joyously in the air as she leans toward him to bestow a kiss in a charmingly old-fashioned manner. Inside the salon, the girls draw the curtain back and clap approvingly. Linking her arm with Fergus's, she walks off with him, presenting a perfect picture of companionship and unity.

As Fergus and Dil leisurely browse through their menus in the comfortable ambiance of a restaurant, a waiter arrives discreetly to place refreshing drinks on their table before departing quietly. Later, as they walk leisurely through an alleyway on their way to her house, a car suddenly speeds toward them with its headlights beaming brightly. With quick reflexes, Fergus pulls her into a nearby doorway, allowing the car to rush past them. The vehicle momentarily stops before screeching away. She watches intently, her eyes following the direction where the car hurriedly sped off.

Another vehicle then pulls up gently behind Dil and Fergus, prompting an affectionate response from her as she tenderly touches his cheek. Enveloped in the darkness, Dil enters a room, while Fergus remains standing like a shadowy figure in the doorway. When she turns on the light, she removes her raincoat, inviting Fergus to enter slowly. He takes in the room's decor with thoughtful curiosity, noting the exaggerated femininity of everything surrounding him. On the mantelpiece, his eyes rest upon a picture of Jody, and the camera closes in on the soldier's smiling face. His moment of reflection is interrupted by the familiar sound of a voice from outside—it's unmistakably Dave's. She opens the window door, and together they observe Dave below on the street, now sporting a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Fergus offers a casual shrug, and she catches his eye, taking a seat next to him with a sense of intent. Fergus remains silent, offering another indifferent shrug. Meanwhile, a burly man approaches her with determination, unexpectedly seizing her and yanking her forcefully from her stool, causing her drink to spill and splash around them. Amid the chaos, he drags her through the throng of people, the barman observing the scene with keen interest. Suddenly, Fergus rises from his spot, navigating through the room toward the exit with urgency. Upon stepping outside, Fergus advances a few yards and is immediately drawn by the sound of raised voices echoing from an alley. His gaze sweeps upward to reveal Dil engaged in a struggle, as she shoves Dave away. Dave retaliates by grasping her and turning her with rough insistence, but Dil defiantly thrashes his arms away, managing to stagger free from his grip. In their disoriented state, they collide with Fergus, who stands as solid as a statue, unflinching in his stance. Dil rewards him with a smile, and Fergus acknowledges it by holding an unspecified object up for her to see. Dave's attention shifts to Fergus, who decisively seizes Dave's wrists and flips him forcefully onto the ground. With authority, Fergus plants his foot on Dave’s neck, applying pressure while glancing at Dil for her reaction. He momentarily intensifies the pressure before Dil bends down to Dave, whose voice has softened to a more subdued tone. Fergus then releases his hold, and Dil grips his arm, guiding him away from the scene. Together, they exit the alley, with Fergus casting a backward glance to confirm that Dave is slowly getting back on his feet. Ascending the stairs with measured steps, Fergus and Dil notice movement further down and spot Dave clutching his neck. In a moment of closeness, Dil leans into Fergus, lifting her face toward his, prompting Fergus to kiss her with tenderness. She retreats inside, shutting the door, while Fergus remains outside, observing Dave as he turns and departs. Emerging from the salon with a radiant smile, Dil approaches Fergus, who reveals a bunch of flowers from behind his back, offering them with a flourish that evokes theatrical emotion. She receives them with laughter, gracefully leaning toward him for a kiss, evoking a classic, old-fashioned romance while the salon girls peek through a curtain and applaud their display. Taking his arm, she strolls off with him, enveloped in a shared moment. Fergus and Dil find themselves perusing their menus when a waiter unobtrusively deposits drinks on their table before departing. Later, as they walk down an alleyway en route to her home, a car abruptly barrels toward them at high speed, headlights blazing. Reacting instinctively, Fergus yanks her into a doorway for safety as the vehicle roars past, halting momentarily before screeching away. She peers toward the spot where the car had momentarily stopped. Another car approaches from behind them, causing her to reach out and touch Fergus's cheek in reassurance. In the enveloping darkness, Dil enters, with Fergus standing like a silent shadow within the doorway. As the room is illuminated, she removes her raincoat, and Fergus steps in deliberately, casting his eyes around and taking note of the overtly feminine décor adorning the space. His attention gravitates toward the mantelpiece, where a photograph of Jody—captured in a soldier's joyous moment—catches his eye. His introspection is abruptly interrupted by an external voice—Dave's—piercing the air outside. She parts the window door, revealing Dave on the street, unmistakably encumbered by a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Fergus shrugs as she sits down next to him, looking directly at him. He remains silent and shrugs again. A burly man suddenly jerks her off the stool, spilling her drink, and drags her through the crowd while the barman watches. Fergus rises and heads to the door, walks a few yards, and hears voices in an alley. He sees Dil pushing Dave away, who then grabs and turns her roughly. She beats his arms away and bumps into Fergus. He remains motionless as she smiles. Dave eyes Fergus, prompting Fergus to grab Dave's wrists and throw him to the ground, pressing his foot on Dave’s neck while looking at Dil. Dil bends low to Dave as his voice softens, and Fergus releases him. She pulls Fergus away from Dave, and they leave the alley, noticing Dave rising behind them. As they climb the stairs, they see Dave holding his neck. Dil leans toward Fergus for a tender kiss before going inside, leaving Fergus looking at Dave, who turns to leave. Later, Dil exits the salon, smiling, and approaches Fergus, who presents her with flowers. She laughs, kisses him, and takes his arm as they walk off together, drawing applause from the salon girls. Fergus and Dil sit with menus as drinks arrive, and later, while walking toward her house, a car suddenly speeds toward them. Fergus pulls her into a doorway for safety. The car stops and screeches away as another car pulls up behind them. Dil touches Fergus's cheek before entering the house, where Fergus slowly follows, observing the room's exaggerated femininity and fixating on a picture of Jody. His thoughts are interrupted by Dave's voice outside, and Dil opens the window to see him in a neck brace on the street.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Fergus shrugs, and she looks at Fergus directly, sitting down next to him. Fergus says nothing and shrugs again. The burly man, resembling a typical nightclub bouncer, comes up to her and suddenly jerks her roughly off the stool, spilling her drink that had just been served by the attentive bartender. He drags her through the crowd, which is typical of the club scene in busy urban areas, as the barman eyes him with a mix of concern and restraint. Fergus suddenly stands and makes his way to the door, propelled by a sense of duty often seen in protective figures. Fergus comes out into the dimly lit street, walks a few yards, and hears voices echoing down an alley. He looks up it and sees Dil, who often visits this side of town, pushing Dave away. Dave, an aggressive young man known for causing trouble, grabs her and turns her roughly, but she, showing surprising strength and resolve, beats his arms away and staggers away from him. They both bump into Fergus, who just stands there, as immovable as a rock, and doesn't move an inch. She smiles, a gesture of relief and gratitude, and he holds it up to show her—a token of their shared understanding. Dave eyes Fergus, whose calm demeanor belies his readiness, who in response grabs Dave's wrists with the skill of someone trained in self-defense and upends him on the ground with ease. Fergus puts his foot on Dave's neck and presses down, looking to Dil, and then presses his foot again to emphasize his point. She bends low to Dave, whose voice is softer with a hint of remorse. Fergus removes his foot, and Dil grabs his arm, drawing him away with gentle insistence. They walk out of the alley, and Fergus looks back to see Dave, stubborn as ever, is rising. Fergus and Dil climb slowly upstairs, noticing a movement lower down the staircase and seeing Dave holding his neck, clearly affected by the confrontation. Dil leans close to Fergus, tilting up her face, and Fergus kisses her tenderly, a moment of unexpected romance in the midst of turmoil. She goes in and closes the door, while Fergus stands, protector-like, and looks down at Dave, who turns to leave with a defeated shuffle. Dil walks out of the salon, an old-style beauty parlor with vintage decor, smiling and walks toward Fergus, who takes a fresh bunch of flowers from behind his back, a classic gesture of affection. She holds them with theatrical feeling, as though on stage, laughs, leans toward him, and kisses him in a classically old-fashioned way, reminiscent of a bygone era, as the girls inside the salon, like spectators at a play, pull back a curtain and clap with delight. She takes his arm, intertwining their lives seamlessly, and walks off with him. Fergus and Dil are looking at their menus when a waiter places drinks on their table, expertly navigating the bustling restaurant floor, and then leaves. They are walking in an alleyway toward her house, located in a quaint but lively neighborhood, when suddenly a car, its headlights glaring, drives very fast toward them, a classic case of reckless driving. Fergus pulls her into a doorway to avoid it, instinctively protective. The car continues down the road, stops briefly as if reconsidering its path, and then screeches off, leaving only the echo of rubber on asphalt. She looks down toward where the car has pulled away, puzzled yet relieved. A car pulls up behind Dil and Fergus, and she touches his cheek, a silent affirmation of their shared ordeal. Dil comes in in the darkness, and Fergus stands like a shadow in the doorway, a sentinel in the night. The light comes on; she takes off her raincoat, revealing her elegant evening attire, as Fergus enters slowly, surveying the room, noticing an exaggerated femininity about everything in it, from the lace curtains to the pastel cushions. Fergus looks at the mantelpiece and sees a picture of Jody, a soldier with a radiant smile and a story hidden behind his eyes, and the camera tracks into the soldier's smiling face, capturing the essence of his character. His reverie is broken by the sound of a voice outside—Dave's, still persistent even in defeat. She opens the window door, and they see Dave on the street, sporting a neck brace, a testament to the evening's rough encounter.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Fergus shrugs and she looks at Fergus directly sitting down next to him. Fergus says nothing and shrugs again. The burly man comes up to her and suddenly jerks her roughly off the stool spilling her drink. He drags her through the crowd as the barman eyes him. Fergus suddenly stands and makes his way to the door. Fergus comes out walks a few yards and hears voices down an alley. He looks up it and sees Dil pushing Dave away. Dave grabs her turns her roughly but she beats his arms away and staggers away from him. They both bump into Fergus who just stands there and does not move an inch. She smiles and he holds it up to show her. Dave eyes Fergus who in response grabs Dave's wrists and upends him on the ground. Fergus puts his foot on Dave's neck and presses down looking to Dil and then presses his foot again. She bends low to Dave whose voice is softer. Fergus removes his foot and Dil grabs his arm drawing him away. They walk out of the alley and Fergus looks back to see Dave is rising. Fergus and Dil climb slowly upstairs noticing a movement lower down the staircase and seeing Dave holding his neck. Dil leans close to Fergus and tilts up her face and Fergus kisses her tenderly. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Dil walks out of the salon smiling and walks toward Fergus who takes a bunch of flowers from behind his back. She holds them with theatrical feeling laughs leans toward him and kisses him in a classically oldfashioned way as the girls inside the salon pull back a curtain and clap. She takes his arm and walks off with him. Fergus and Dil are looking at their menus when a waiter places drinks on their table and then leaves. They are walking in an alleyway toward her house when suddenly a car drives very fast toward them with headlights on. Fergus pulls her into a doorway to avoid it. The car continues down the road stops and then screeches off. She looks down toward where the car has pulled away. A car pulls up behind Dil and Fergus and she touches his cheek. Dil comes in in the darkness and Fergus stands like a shadow in the doorway. The light comes on. she takes off her raincoat as Fergus enters slowly. He looks around the room noticing an exaggerated femininity about everything in it. Fergus looks at the mantelpiece and sees a picture of Jody and the camera tracks into the soldier's smiling face. His reverie is broken by the sound of a voice outside—Dave's. She opens the window door and they see Dave on the street in a neck brace.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Humphrey yawns, and he glances at Humphrey briefly, sprawling down beside him. Humphrey utters nothing and yawns again. The slender woman strolls over to him and suddenly nudges him gently off the perch, scattering his sandwich. She pulls him through the crowd as the waiter observes her. Humphrey abruptly rises and wanders toward the window. Humphrey steps out, skips a few steps, and hears music up a passage. He glances down it and spots Kim shoving Tom aside. Tom seizes him, twists him gently, but he shakes his hands free and stumbles away from her. They both collide with Humphrey, who just stands there and doesn't flinch a bit. He grins, and she raises it to show him. Tom watches Humphrey, who in reply grips Tom's shoulders and flips her onto the floor. Humphrey places his toe on Tom's ear and leans down, looking to Kim, and then leans his toe again. He crouches low to Tom, whose breath is quieter. Humphrey lifts his toe, and Kim clasps his leg, tugging him away. They skip out of the passage, and Humphrey glances back to see Tom is standing. Humphrey and Kim amble slowly downstairs, spotting a shadow lower down the stairwell and seeing Tom clutching her ear. Kim sidles close to Humphrey and tilts down his hand, and Humphrey hugs him warmly. He steps in and shuts the gate, while Humphrey strolls and glances up at Tom, who spins to depart. Kim steps out of the bakery chuckling and ambles toward Humphrey, who pulls a bouquet of balloons from behind his ear. He clutches them with dramatic excitement, chuckles, leans toward him, and hugs him in a modernly contemporary manner as the children inside the bakery pull back a curtain and cheer. He clutches his hand and skips off with him. Humphrey and Kim are peering at their maps when a dancer sets pastries on their tray and then exits. They are skipping down a boulevard toward his garage when suddenly a wagon glides very slowly toward them with taillights off. Humphrey nudges him into a hallway to approach it. The wagon continues up the lane, pauses, and then coasts off. He glances up toward where the wagon has coasted toward. A van coasts in front of Kim and Humphrey, and he brushes his elbow. Kim strolls out in the daylight, and Humphrey stands like a shadow in the hallway. The light dims; he pulls on his jacket as Humphrey exits swiftly. She glances around the yard, observing a subtle masculinity about everything in it. Humphrey glances at the bookshelf and spots a sculpture of Kevin, and the drone scans across the artist's grinning lips. Her daydream is lifted by the tune of a melody inside—Tom's. He opens the attic door, and they spot Tom in the room, with a wrist brace.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Fergus sits silently beside a woman who is dragged away by a burly man, spilling her drink. Fergus follows and encounters Dil, who is fending off Dave in an alley. Fergus intervenes, subduing Dave by pinning him down. Dil pulls Fergus away, and they walk together, noticing Dave rising. As Dil and Fergus ascend stairs, they spot a hurt Dave. Fergus tenderly kisses Dil goodbye. Later, Dil leaves a salon, joyfully accepting flowers from Fergus. They share a kiss as salon patrons applaud. While dining, a speeding car targets them, and Fergus swiftly pulls Dil to safety. They retreat to Dil's home, where Fergus observes the decor and a picture of Jody. His thoughts are interrupted by Dave’s voice outside. Dil opens a window to see Dave on the street wearing a neck brace.
